data.name: AbsoluteRefreshTokenLifetime_Info
data.value: Maximum lifetime of a refresh token in seconds. Defaults to 2592000 seconds / 30 days

data.name: AccessTokenLifetime_Info
data.value: Lifetime of access token in seconds (defaults to 3600 seconds / 1 hour)

data.name: AccessTokenTypes_Info
data.value: Specifies whether the access token is a reference token or a self contained JWT token (defaults to Jwt).

data.name: AllowAccessTokensViaBrowser_Info
data.value: Specifies whether this client is allowed to receive access tokens via the browser. This is useful to harden flows that allow multiple response types (e.g. by disallowing a hybrid flow client that is supposed to use code id_token to add the token response type and thus leaking the token to the browser.

data.name: AllowOfflineAccess_Info
data.value: Specifies whether this client can request refresh tokens (be requesting the offline_access scope)

data.name: AllowPlainTextPkce_Info
data.value: Specifies whether clients using PKCE can use a plain text code challenge (not recommended - and default to false)

data.name: AllowRememberConsent_Info
data.value: Specifies whether user can choose to store consent decisions. Defaults to true.

data.name: AlwaysIncludeUserClaimsInIdToken_Label
data.value: Always Include User Claims In IdToken

data.name: AlwaysSendClientClaims_Info
data.value: If set, the client claims will be sent for every flow. If not, only for client credentials flow (default is false)

data.name: AuthorizationCodeLifetime_Info
data.value: Lifetime of authorization code in seconds (defaults to 300 seconds / 5 minutes)

data.name: ClientName_Info
data.value: Client display name (used for logging and consent screen)

data.name: ClientUri_Info
data.value: URI to further information about client (used on consent screen)

data.name: Enabled_Info
data.value: Specifies if client is enabled. Defaults to true.

data.name: EnableLocalLogin_Info
data.value: Specifies if this client can use local accounts, or external IdPs only. Defaults to true.

data.name: IdentityTokenLifetime_Info
data.value: Lifetime to identity token in seconds (defaults to 300 seconds / 5 minutes)

data.name: IncludeJwtId_Info
data.value: Specifies whether JWT access tokens should have an embedded unique ID (via the jti claim).

data.name: LogoUri_Info
data.value: URI to client logo (used on consent screen)

data.name: RefreshTokenExpiration_Info
data.value:
Absolute the refresh token will expire on a fixed point in time (specified by the AbsoluteRefreshTokenLifetime)
Sliding when refreshing the token, the lifetime of the refresh token will be renewed (by the amount specified in SlidingRefreshTokenLifetime). The lifetime will not exceed AbsoluteRefreshTokenLifetime.

data.name: RefreshTokenUsage.Info
data.value:
ReUse the refresh token handle will stay the same when refreshing tokens
OneTime the refresh token handle will be updated when refreshing tokens

data.name: RefreshTokenUsage_Info
data.value:
ReUse the refresh token handle will stay the same when refreshing tokens
OneTime the refresh token handle will be updated when refreshing tokens

data.name: RequireClientSecret_Info
data.value: Specifies whether this client needs a secret to request tokens from the token endpoint (defaults to true)

data.name: RequireConsent_Info
data.value: Specifies whether a consent screen is required. Defaults to true.

data.name: RequirePkce_Info
data.value: Specifies whether clients using an authorization code based grant type must send a proof key

data.name: SlidingRefreshTokenLifetime_Info
data.value: Sliding lifetime of a refresh token in seconds. Defaults to 1296000 seconds / 15 days

data.name: UpdateAccessTokenClaimsOnRefresh_Info
data.value: Gets or sets a value indicating whether the access token (and its claims) should be updated on a refresh token request.

data.name: UpdateAccessTokenClaimsOnRefresh_Label
data.value: Update Access Token Claims On Refresh

data.name: AllowedCorsOrigins_Info
data.value: If specified, will be used by the default CORS policy service implementations (In-Memory and EF) to build a CORS policy for JavaScript clients.

data.name: AllowedGrantTypes_Info
data.value: Specifies the grant types the client is allowed to use. Use the GrantTypes class for common combinations. List of default grants: Implicit Grant - (implicit), Client Credentials Grant - (client_credentials), Authorization Code Grant - (authorization_code), Hybrid grant - (hybrid), Resource Owner Password Credentials Grant - (password)

data.name: AllowedScopes_Info
data.value: By default a client has no access to any resources - specify the allowed resources by adding the corresponding scopes names

data.name: Claims_Info
data.value: Allows settings claims for the client (will be included in the access token).

data.name: ClientSecrets_Info
data.value: List of client secrets - credentials to access the token endpoint.

data.name: IdentityProviderRestrictions_Info
data.value: Specifies which external IdPs can be used with this client (if list is empty all IdPs are allowed). Defaults to empty.

data.name: PostLogoutRedirectUris_Info
data.value: Specifies allowed URIs to redirect to after logout

data.name: RedirectUris_Info
data.value: Specifies the allowed URIs to return tokens or authorization codes to

data.name: BackChannelLogoutSessionRequired_Info
data.value: Specifies if the user’s session id should be sent in the request to the BackChannelLogoutUri. Defaults to true.

data.name: BackChannelLogoutUri_Info
data.value: Specifies logout URI at client for HTTP based back-channel logout. See the OIDC Back-Channel spec for more details.

data.name: ClientClaimsPrefix_Info
data.value: If set, the prefix client claim types will be prefixed with. Defaults to client_. The intent is to make sure they don’t accidentally collide with user claims.

data.name: FrontChannelLogoutSessionRequired_Info
data.value: Specifies if the user’s session id should be sent to the FrontChannelLogoutUri. Defaults to true.

data.name: FrontChannelLogoutUri_Info
data.value: Specifies logout URI at client for HTTP based front-channel logout. See the OIDC Front-Channel spec for more details.

data.name: PairWiseSubjectSalt_Info
data.value: Salt value used in pair-wise subjectId generation for users of this client.

data.name: Properties_Info
data.value: Dictionary to hold any custom client-specific values as needed.

data.name: UserSsoLifetime_Info
data.value: The maximum duration (in seconds) since the last time the user authenticated. Defaults to null

data.name: DeviceCodeLifetime_Info
data.value: Lifetime to device code in seconds (defaults to 300 seconds / 5 minutes)

data.name: UserCodeType_Info
data.value: Specifies the type of user code to use for the client. Otherwise falls back to default.
